channel.title: Dichotomy
channel.description: To iterate is human, to recurse, divine

item.title: Leetcode
item.dc:creator: suzumiya natsuhi
item.description:
599. Minimum Index Sum of Two Lists

Solution 


class Solution {
  public:
    vector<string> findRestaurant(vector<string> &list1,
                                  vector<string> &list2) {
        unordered_map<string, int> umsi;
        for (int i = 0; i < list1.size(); i++) {
            umsi[list1[i]] = i;
        }

        int idx_sum = INT_MAX;
        vector<string> vsr;
        for (int i = 0; i < list2.size(); i++) {
            if (umsi.find(list2[i]) != umsi.end()) {
                if (idx_sum > i + umsi[list2[i]]) {
                    vsr.clear();
                    vsr.push_back(list2[i]);
                    idx_sum = i + umsi[list2[i]];
                } else if (idx_sum == i + umsi[list2[i]]) {
                    vsr.push_back(list2[i]);
                }
            }
        }

        return vsr;
    }
};




Status: Accepted (133/133)

Runtime: 104 ms, faster than 98.98% of C++ submissions.

Memory Usage: 36.9 MB, less than 63.53% of C++ submissions.

item.title: Leetcode617. Merge Two Binary Trees
item.dc:creator: suzumiya natsuhi
item.description:
617. Merge Two Binary Trees

Solution 


/**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left),
 * right(right) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
  public:
    TreeNode *mergeTrees(TreeNode *t1, TreeNode *t2) {
        if (t1 == NULL && t2 == NULL)
            return NULL;
        TreeNode *t3 = new TreeNode((t1 == NULL ? 0 : t1->val) +
                                    (t2 == NULL ? 0 : t2->val));
        t3->left = mergeTrees(t1 == NULL ? NULL : t1->left,
                              t2 == NULL ? NULL : t2->left);
        t3->right = mergeTrees(t1 == NULL ? NULL : t1->right,
                               t2 == NULL ? NULL : t2->right);
        return t3;
    }
};



Status: Accepted (183/183)

Runtime: 56 ms, faster than 47.43% of C++ submissions.

Memory Usage: 35.7 MB, less than 5.05% of C++ submissions.

item.title: Leetcode668. Employee Importance
item.dc:creator: suzumiya natsuhi
item.description:
690. Employee Importance 


/*
// Definition for Employee.
class Employee {
public:
    int id;
    int importance;
    vector<int> subordinates;
};
*/

class Solution {
  public:
    int getImportance(vector<Employee *> employees, int id) {

        unordered_map<int, Employee *> umii;
        for (Employee *e : employees) {
            umii[e->id] = e;
        }

        int importance = 0;
        queue<int> qi;
        qi.push(id);

        int tmp;
        while (!qi.empty()) {
            tmp = qi.front();
            importance += umii[tmp]->importance;
            qi.pop();
            for (int i : umii[tmp]->subordinates)
                qi.push(i);
        }

        return importance;
    }
};




Status: Accepted (108/108)

Runtime: 36 ms, faster than 92.63% of C++ submissions.

Memory Usage: 14.4 MB, less than 27.87% of C++ submissions.

item.title: Leetcode649 Second Minimum Node In a Binary Tree
item.dc:creator: suzumiya natsuhi
item.description:
671. Second Minimum Node In a Binary Tree

Solution 


/**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left),
 * right(right) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
  public:
    int fm = -1, sm = -1;
    int findSecondMinimumValue(TreeNode *root) {
        if (root == NULL)
            return sm;

        if (fm == -1)
            fm = root->val;
        else {
            if (sm == -1) {
                if (root->val > fm)
                    sm = root->val;
                else if (root->val < fm) {
                    sm = fm;
                    fm = root->val;
                } else {
                    // do nothing
                }
            } else {
                if (root->val > sm) {
                    // do noting
                } else if (root->val < fm) {
                    sm = fm;
                    fm = root->val;
                } else if (root->val == sm || root->val == fm) {
                    // do nothing
                } else { // root->val > fm and root->val < sm;
                    sm = root->val;
                }
            }
        }

        findSecondMinimumValue(root->left);
        findSecondMinimumValue(root->right);

        return sm;
    }
};



Status: Accepted (35/35)

Runtime: 0 ms, faster than 100.00% of C++ submissions.

Memory Usage: 7.2 MB, less than 17.00% of C++ submissions.

自从学会了一种偷懒的写法之后，就一直用这种 travel 的方法。

item.title: Leetcode804 Most Common Word
item.dc:creator: suzumiya natsuhi
item.description:
819. Most Common Word

Solution 


class Solution {
  public:
    string mostCommonWord(string paragraph, vector<string> &banned) {
        unordered_map<string, int> umsi;
        int start, end;
        transform(paragraph.begin(),paragraph.end(),paragraph.begin(),::tolower);
        for (int i = 0; i < paragraph.length(); i++) {
            while (i < paragraph.length() && !isalpha(paragraph[i]))
                i++;
            start = i;
            while (i < paragraph.length() && isalpha(paragraph[i]))
                i++;
            end = i;
            umsi[paragraph.substr(start, end - start)]++;
        }

        for (string s : banned)
            if (umsi.find(s) != umsi.end())
                umsi.erase(s);

        string w = "";
        for (auto it : umsi) {
            if (w == "")
                w = it.first;
            else if (umsi[it.first] > umsi[w])
                w = it.first;
        }

        return w;
    }
};



Status: Accepted (47/47)

Runtime: 4 ms, faster than 99.63% of C++ submissions.

Memory Usage: 7.8 MB, less than 87.14% of C++ submissions.

item.title: 调试的时候出了一个问题
item.dc:creator: suzumiya natsuhi
item.description:
821. Shortest Distance to a Character

一个 gdb 调试的问题，没太看明白（暴哭）：

想到可能是类型的问题： size_type 是一个无符号的整数， int 是有符号整数，有符号整数首先转换成无符号整数。 -1 转化成 0xffffffff ，所以应该是没有问题的。

同时有一个问题：转化时为什么是有符号整数转换成无符号整数，而不是相反呢？

item.title: Leetcode107 Binary Tree Level Order Traversal II
item.dc:creator: suzumiya natsuhi
item.description:
107. Binary Tree Level Order Traversal II

Solution 


/**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left),
 * right(right) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
  public:
    vector<vector<int>> levelOrderBottom(TreeNode *root) {
        vector<vector<int>> result;

        queue<TreeNode *> q;
        TreeNode *last, *end;
        if (root) {
            q.push(root);
            end = root;
            last = end;
            result.push_back(vector<int>{});
        }
        while (!q.empty()) {
            TreeNode *temp = q.front();
            result[result.size() - 1].push_back(temp->val);
            q.pop();
            if (temp->left)q.push(temp->left);
            if (temp->right)q.push(temp->right);
            if (temp == last && !q.empty())result.push_back(vector<int>{}); // 达到一层结尾还有元素就增加一个空 vector
            if (temp == last)last=q.back();
        }
        reverse(result.begin(), result.end());
        return result;
    }
};

二叉树的层序遍历，稍微修改一下就行。 


Status: Accepted (34/34)

Runtime: 4 ms, faster than 91.99% of C++ submissions.

Memory Usage: 12.5 MB, less than 97.56% of C++ submissions.

item.title: Leetcode108 Convert Sorted Array to Binary Search Tree
item.dc:creator: suzumiya natsuhi
item.description:
108. Convert Sorted Array to Binary Search Tree

Solution 


/**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left),
 * right(right) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
  public:
    TreeNode *sortedArrayToBST(vector<int> &nums) {
        // create tree
        return toHeightBST(nums, 0, nums.size() - 1);
    }

    TreeNode *toHeightBST(vector<int> &nums, int l, int r) {
        if (l > r)
            return NULL;
        int mid = l + (r - l) / 2;
        TreeNode *root = new TreeNode(nums[mid]);
        root->left = toHeightBST(nums, l, mid - 1);
        root->right = toHeightBST(nums, mid + 1, r);
        return root;
    }
};

一开始以为是树的高度的调整题，后来发现这个和 用数组表示的树构造一棵树 的做法差不多。

item.title: Leetcode937 Reorder Data in Log Files
item.dc:creator: suzumiya natsuhi
item.description:
937. Reorder Data in Log Files

Solution 


class Solution {
    public:
        vector<string> reorderLogFiles(vector<string> &logs) {
            stable_sort(begin(logs), end(logs), [](auto &a, auto &b) {
                auto A = 1 + a.find(' '), B = 1 + b.find(' ');
                return a[A] > '@' &&
                    (b[B] < '@' ||
                     a.substr(A).append(a, 0, A) < b.substr(B).append(b, 0, B));
            });
            return logs;
        }
};

先找到 identifier 和后面部分的分隔点 A 和 B ，然后用 '@' 作为判断后面是数字还是字母的基准。ASCII 码表中， '0' 和 '9' 分别是 48 和 57 ， '@' 是 64 ， 'a' 和 'z' 分别是 97 和 122 。 return 后的部分同时保证了 letter-logs 排在 digit-logs 的前面；后部分（数字或者字母）拼接 identifier 后用字典序排列，也即后部分如果恰好相同时， identifier dominating。

这个写法是翻解答时看到的，比较简洁，如果熟悉 sort 的话也比较容易懂。sort 的关键还是后面的函数 template< class RandomIt, class Compare > void stable_sort( RandomIt first, RandomIt last, Compare comp ); 。

item.title: Replace v2ray config outbounds with vmess
item.dc:creator: suzumiya natsuhi
item.description:
• v2ray on linux

    v2ray 在 linux 平台上并不也不计划支持将 vmess-url 转换成可用的 v2ray 配置文件（我猜考虑到这些有端口和系统代理设置而在 linux 平台上这些是单独的功能）。也有人使用 python 脚本转换，代码没有仔细看。不过我想到自己已经有在使用的配置文件，即使转化 vmess url 也不能完全用，有用的部分是 outbounds （即出口部分，提供 v2ray 服务的主机相关），所以打断取出 vmess url 的 outbound 部分合并到现有的 /etc/v2ray/config.json 中使用。

  • 目标

    目标是将 vmess-url 转换成可用的 v2ray 配置文件，然后抽取其中的 outbounds[0] 替换原有 v2ray 配置文件的 outbounds[0] 部分。因为原有文件设置的路由还有 inbounds 已经有而且不打算更改这部分内容。

  • vmess urls

    将可得的所有的 vmess urls 存入一个文件 vmess-url.info 。

  • 命令行 json 操作

    安装 v2ray-tools 工具: npm -g install v2ray-tools 。

  • 转换 shell 脚本 

    
    vmess_file_path=$1      # vmdss-url.info 路径
    line_num=$2             # 使用的 vmess-url 行号
    config_file_path=$3     # 待合并的原配置。一般是 /etc/v2ray/config.json
    output_config_file_path=$4  # 合并后的 config.json

    line=`sed -n $(line_num)p $vmess_file_path`                         # 获取 vmess-url
    result=`v2ray-tools vmess2config --port 8080 --url $line`           # 利用 v2ray-tools 生成配置文件
    outbound0=`echo $result | jq '.outbounds[0]'`                       # 获取生成配置文件的 outbounds[0] 部分
    config=`cat "/etc/v2ray/config.json"`                               # 获取原配置
    replace_config=`echo $config | jq -r ".outbounds[0]=$outbound0"`    # 替换原配置的 outbounds[0] 为 vmess-url 的 outbounds[0]
    echo '$replace_config' > $output_config_file_path                   # 写出文件，也可以直接写入 /etc/v2ray/config.json 需要 root 权限

    # usage: vmess-url-to-config-json.sh ~/vmess-url.info 2 /etc/config/config.json ~/config.json

    这样就得到了 config.json 文件，然后可用 v2ray 检查： v2ray -test -config ~/config.json 。可替换系统的默认配置文件 /etc/v2ray/config.json ，并重启服务 sudo systemctl restart v2ray.service 。
